subject: Learning
title: Visual, Auditory, Kinesthetic: The Big Myth
description: A 60-second lesson on Visual, Auditory, Kinesthetic: The Big Myth.

hook.text: Schools label students as visual, auditory, or kinesthetic learners. It sounds scientific. It's not.

buildup.text: The learning styles theory says matching instruction to a student's style boosts outcomes.

discovery.text: Over 30 studies have tested this hypothesis. None found evidence that matching styles helps learning.

twist.text: People do have preferencesâ€”but teaching to a preference doesn't improve performance. It just feels nicer.

climax.text: The best evidence says: match the method to the content, not the student.

punchline.text: Learning styles feel real. The evidence says otherwise.

quiz.question: What does research say about learning styles?
options: No evidence that matching instruction to styles improves learning
